cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles SSE of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the western Gulf, expected to skirt the northeast Mexican and lower Texas coasts Monday and then turn north toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-to-central Texas coast (likely between Corpus Christi and Matagorda Island)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Port Aransas to High Island, TX (tropical-storm watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Aransas, TX (tropical-storm warning); Barra el Mezquital MX to the U.S./Mexico border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northeast Mexico coast through the lower and central Texas Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (around 40 mph with higher gusts) possible Monday afternoon through early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible along the lower Texas coast, including the Brownsville area, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated amounts up to 15 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and rip currents; brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; power outages and port operational disruptions likely
